title: Is anybody gonna talk about how Ezreal's rework is a straight buff?
body:
Riot didn't change a single thing about Ezreal's kit besides his W, which is one of the worst spells in the game and something you usually don't even use past level 8. With the strength of his new W I feel like hes going to be way stronger and will have a 52%+ winrate from the changes and will be a pick or ban champion. I think its fine he got a new W but riot should nerf some of his other abilities if they are going to add this. 
Edit: some people didn't know that it works on towers

It's a nice buff but "pick or ban" tier seems to be a gross overestimation of how strong he'll be
He's at 48% WR currently so he'll probably go up to 49-50% WR with this buff assuming it doesnt get dragged down by the influx of new Ez players
you really underestimate the damage he does to towers with his W and he has a 30% pickrate it won't go up by much

> [{quoted}](name=Hextech OwI,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mxIdtA3w,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-26T21:13:31.201+0000)
>
> Tristana had her E changed, Alistar had his passive and E exchanged (months after his VU though). I don't remember anyone else.

It's worth noting that, in both cases, those were more-or-less power neutral changes.

Tristana lost a powerful no-skill harass tool which doubled as crippling any and all sustain.

Alistar lost his on demand team-wide sustain abilities, meaning that he can't as effectively sustain his adc in lane / team between team fights. He also had a substantial nerf to his ultimate via losing all the free AD on it, which made him shockingly dangerous in early trades.

In Ezreal's case, W doesn't exist anyway. So it's a straight-up buff. No questions asked, no power trades, just a crapton more power with no trade off.
Somebody doesn't seem to know that you could E into your own W on Ezreal to get the buff and deal extra damage at the same time. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

which is something you almost never want to do. Losing your E for that is not good.

What you could do however is W allies and buff them + yourself which is something alot of people don't seem to realize.

maybe its adding his lack of power because his W was useless as fuck he only had 4 reliable abilities Q,E,R,P  now he has 5 reliable abilities like every other champ. did you think about that?

Except he's had his four real abilities balanced to the same power budget as other champions kits since forever. Giving him a W that qualifies as a full ability could give him 120% of the power budget of a normal champion. It's probably not that high but even only going up to 105%-110% is serious. 5-10% on an already competitive champion is a serious buff.

Edit changed the budget percent stuff

Ezreal's outdated model is going to stand out in significantly more games than someone like Mordekaiser. The W rework has been a long time coming because the ability was borderline useless. They decided to kill two birds with one stone.

It works on all __objectives__ (Dragon, Baron, Herald, Turrets) doesn't work on jungle monsters or minions. Yeah its gonna be broken, but you still have to land your skillshots, or just auto for less damage. 

What we SHOULD be worry about is the refunded mana +60 more.

the base cost on his W is 50, and it only refunds 60 if he detonates it with an ability (meaning he can't W+auto to refund and also meaning the mana gain isn't positive). this means chaining two skillshots or using his E to force mana return, and this is an ability that in lane is only usable on champs.

As someone that has tried to "main" ryze and failed/given up trust me it is very hard to consistently mark enemy champs and then hit them with a linear minion-blockable skillshot

Tbf His E auto-targets the person with the mark. 

It's not easier to hit someone with a minion-blockable skillshot true, but that doesn't matter when you have an auto-targetting undodgeable spell.

Yes, but that means you have to use arcane shift offensively, leaving you vulnerable.

That makes Ezreal a less safe and passive champ.

That's true yeah but I wasn't saying that using that combo doesn't have downsides. 

I was just pointing out that the argument of the linear skill shot doesn't really apply.
It somewhat applies, because often you won't want to put yourself at risk, so you'd rather either Q or do nothing.

any good ezreal knows to use arcane shift sparingly, its the highest costing basic ability that drains mana quickly in lane. if you use it offensively it'd better be to finish off/catch someone, but its still not a great idea.
Tell me a rework that wasn't a buff lel

It just gave him more reliable burst damage, even if you want to build AD
